intro: Trophaeum kingii, commonly known as King's rock cress, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of South America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. It has a low-growing habit with rosettes of narrow, grass-like leaves. Trophaeum kingii is adapted to cold, rocky environments and is often found in high-altitude habitats.
